author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Please make sure to add some documentation before registering. Currently, the README is empty, and the "Example" in the online documentation shows no code and lacks context.

I would recommend a paragraph in the README to explain the purpose of the package, as well as a minimal but complete usage example. Since registration is intended to make the package available to the wider community, providing information about what the package does and how to use it is essential for it to be useful to others.

"Interesting", that the "you" in "If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment." apparently means anyone (contributor?). 

In any case, @goerz: I'm not sure which "Example" in the online documentation you refer to that lacks code? 

(I've done some changes to the README as requested and added a few words to the example in the meantime).

[noblock]

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]

I'm sorry, somehow this slipped through (I should have unblocked this on Nov 13). In any case, the documentation seems fine now. So please feel free to try re-registering. It should auto-merge this time.

> "Interesting", that the "you" in "If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment." 

Yes, that is by design. The General registry is a community resource. Some issues with new registrations can be flagged by bots, but others (like incomplete documentation) cannot, so anyone can flag these submissions.

Usually, after issues are fixed, the registration should be unblocked for automatic merging. Again, I'm sorry that didn't happen in this case.
